alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 7:31PM CDT until April 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR JOHNSON...WESTERN NEMAHA...WESTERN OTOE AND PAWNEE COUNTIES... At 731 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Syracuse to 4 miles west of Johnson to 6 miles east of Summerfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 723 PM, half dollar sized hail was reported 6 miles south of Burchard. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Syracuse, Johnson, Cook, Unadilla, Dunbar, Talmage, Brock, Lorton, Table Rock and Elk Creek. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
